products.name: protein
products.desc: Found in certain meals, good for bodily health.

products.name: mold
products.desc: A fungal growth, often found in dark, humid places or on expired bread. Will cause you to develop a disease if ingested.

products.name: protein
products.desc: Found in certain meals, good for bodily health.

products.name: toxin
products.desc: An unsurprisingly toxic chemical. Available at an emagged chem dispenser.

products.name: EZ nutrient
products.desc: Give your plants some of those EZ nutrients! Dionas find this delicious.

products.name: robust harvest
products.desc: A highly effective fertilizer with a limited potency-boosting effect on plants. Use it cautiously, as excessive application can reduce plant yield. It has a particularly beneficial effect on dionas.

products.name: sedin
products.desc: A modified version of diethylamine that can restore seeds on plants at the cost of potency.

products.name: left-4-zed
products.desc: A cocktail of mutagenic compounds that gives nutrients, harms and affects plant life's genome.

products.name: plant-B-gone
products.desc: A harmful toxic mixture to kill plantlife. Very effective against kudzu.

products.name: ammonia
products.desc: An effective fertilizer, it gives your plants some nutrients.

products.name: sugar
products.desc: Tasty spacey sugar!

products.name: carbon
products.desc: A black, crystalline solid.

products.name: diethylamine
products.desc: A very potent fertilizer, treats plants with nutrients, eliminates pests, and sometimes it can even speed up growth.

products.name: phenol
products.desc: An aromatic ring of carbon with a hydroxyl group. A useful precursor to some medicines, but has no healing properties on its own.

products.name: acetone
products.desc: A slick, slightly carcinogenic liquid. Has a multitude of mundane uses in everyday life.

products.name: foaming agent
products.desc: Makes foam such as that's required in metal foam grenades.

products.name: polytrinic acid
products.desc: An extremely corrosive chemical substance. Severely burns anyone who comes directly into contact with it.

products.name: sulfuric acid
products.desc: A corrosive chemical. Keep away from your face.

products.name: fluorosulfuric acid
products.desc: A highly corrosive chemical, capable of leaving quite a mark on your skin.

products.name: table salt
products.desc: Commonly known as salt, Sodium Chloride is often used to season food or kill borers instantly.

products.name: chlorine
products.desc: A yellow-green gas which is toxic to humans.

products.name: sodium
products.desc: A silvery-white alkali metal. Highly reactive in its pure form.

products.name: thermite
products.desc: A mixture that becomes extremely hot when ignited.

products.name: unstable mutagen
products.desc: Causes mutations when injected into living people or plants. High doses may be lethal, especially in humans.

products.name: oil
products.desc: Used by chefs to cook.

products.name: fluorosurfactant
products.desc: A perfluoronated sulfonic acid that forms a foam when mixed with water.

products.name: desoxyephedrine
products.desc: A more effective ephedrine, with more active downsides. Requires less doses to cure narcolepsy.

products.name: hyperzine
products.desc: A chemical cocktail developed by Donk Co. that allows agents to recover from stuns faster, move more quickly, and grants a small heal when you're more dead than alive. Due to the complex nature of the chemical, it is much harder for the body to purge naturally.

products.name: ephedrine
products.desc: A caffeinated adrenaline stimulator chemical that makes you faster and harder to knock down. Also helps combat narcolepsy at dosages over thirty, at the cost of severe nerval stress.

products.name: mute toxin
products.desc: A thick chemical that coats the vocal cords, making the user unable to speak during metabolization.

products.name: chloral hydrate
products.desc: A sedative and hypnotic chemical. Commonly used to put other people to sleep, whether they want to or not.

products.name: pax
products.desc: A psychiatric chemical which prevents the patient from directly harming anyone.

products.name: charcoal
products.desc: A black, porous solid

products.name: norepinephric acid
products.desc: A smooth chemical that blocks the optical receptors, rendering the user blind during metabolization.

products.name: ethyloxyephedrine
products.desc: A mildly unstable medicine derived from desoxyephedrine, primarily used to combat narcolepsy.

products.name: diphenylmethylamine
products.desc: A more stable medicine than ethyloxyephedrine. Useful for keeping someone awake.

products.name: sodium carbonate
products.desc: A white, odorless, water-soluble salt that yields an alkaline solution in water.  Also known as soda ash.

products.name: benzene
products.desc: An aromatic, slightly carcinogenic, ring of carbon, forming a base for many organic compounds.

products.name: hydroxide
products.desc: A strong alkaline chemical, forming a base for many organic compounds.

products.name: sodium hydroxide
products.desc: A white, odorless, water-soluble salt that yields an strong alkaline solution in water. Causes burns and vomiting when ingested.

products.name: fersilicite
products.desc: An intermetallic compound with unusual magnetic properties at low temperatures.

products.name: sodium polyacrylate
products.desc: A super-absorbent polymer with assorted industrial uses.

products.name: nocturine
products.desc: A highly effective sedative and hypnotic, developed by the Syndicate for stealth operations. One-way ticket to honk-shoo town.

products.name: tazinide
products.desc: A highly dangerous metallic mixture which can interfere with most movement through an electrifying current.

products.name: artifact glue
products.desc: Mixture of glue and artifexium. It can restore durability of nodes in artifact on touch.

products.name: lye
products.desc: A translucent, orange, alkaline solution used in traditional soap production.

products.name: bleach
products.desc: Heavy duty cleaner that can clean tiles better than Space Cleaner. Extremely toxic when ingested.

products.name: ammonia
products.desc: An effective fertilizer, it gives your plants some nutrients.

products.name: space cleaner
products.desc: This is able to clean almost all surfaces of almost anything that may dirty them. The janitor is likely to appreciate refills.

products.name: space lube
products.desc: Space Lube is a high performance lubricant intended for maintenance of extremely complex mechanical equipment (and certainly not used to make people slip).

products.name: acidspit
products.desc: A drink for the daring, can be deadly if incorrectly prepared!

products.name: alien brain hemorrhage
products.desc: You might want to get that checked out at Med.

products.name: allies cocktail
products.desc: A drink made from your allies, not as sweet as when made from your enemies.

products.name: amasec
products.desc: Official drink of the Gun Club!

products.name: Andalusia
products.desc: A nice, strangely named drink.

products.name: antifreeze
products.desc: Ultimate refreshment.

products.name: Arnold Palmer
products.desc: Now watch this drive.

products.name: Atomic Bomb
products.desc: Nuclear proliferation never tasted so good.

products.name: B-52
products.desc: Coffee, irish cream, and cognac. You will get bombed.

products.name: budget insuls
products.desc: A tider's preferred drink.

products.name: Blue Hawaiian
products.desc: Aloha! Does that mean hello or goodbye?

products.name: Cogchamp
products.desc: Not even Ratvar's Four Generals could withstand this! Qevax Jryy!

products.name: Bahama Mama
products.desc: Tropical cocktail.

products.name: barefoot
products.desc: A cassis milkshake, made from cream, fruit juice, and vermouth wine.

products.name: Banana Honk
products.desc: A drink from Clown Heaven.

products.name: Beepsky smash
products.desc: Deny drinking this and prepare for THE LAW.

products.name: Black Russian
products.desc: For the lactose-intolerant. Still as classy as a White Russian.

products.name: Bloody Mary
products.desc: A strange yet pleasurable mixture made of vodka, tomato, and lime juice.

products.name: booger
products.desc: Ewww...

products.name: Brave Bull
products.desc: It's just as effective as Dutch-Courage!

products.name: Bronx
products.desc: The orange-flavoured cousin of the Manhattan and Martini.

products.name: cafe latte
products.desc: A nice, strong and tasty beverage while you are reading.

products.name: coconut rum
products.desc: Rum with coconut for that tropical feel.

products.name: cosmopolitan
products.desc: Even in the worst situations, nothing beats a fresh cosmopolitan.

products.name: cream of coconut
products.desc: Sweet, syrupy version of coconut cream with added sugar.

products.name: crush depth
products.desc: A stygian drink, harkening back to the abyssopelagic. Dark and Cold, it serves as a reminder that the most ancient emotion is fear, and the strongest type of fear is that of the unknown.

products.name: Cuba libre
products.desc: Rum, mixed with cola. Viva la revolucion.

products.name: dark & stormy
products.desc: You can almost hear the thunder.

products.name: Demon's Blood
products.desc: AHHHH!!!!

products.name: Devil's Kiss
products.desc: Creepy time!

products.name: The Doctor's Delight
products.desc: A gulp a day keeps the MediBot away. That's probably for the best.

products.name: driest martini
products.desc: Only for the experienced. You think you see sand floating in the glass.

products.name: eggnog
products.desc: Not enough egg.

products.name: electric shark
products.desc: Fun Shark fact: Selachians make up 20% of Space Station 16’s Engineering staff!

products.name: Erika surprise
products.desc: The surprise is, it's green!

products.name: hydrogen
products.desc: A light, flammable gas.

products.name: carbon
products.desc: A black, crystalline solid.

products.name: oxygen
products.desc: An oxidizing, colorless gas.

products.name: Fourteen Loko
products.desc: A highly processed liquid substance barely-passing intergalatic health standards for a soft drink.

products.name: Pan-Galactic Gargle Blaster
products.desc: Whoah, this stuff looks volatile!

products.name: gin fizz
products.desc: Refreshingly lemony, deliciously dry.

products.name: gin and tonic
products.desc: An all time classic, mild cocktail.

products.name: Gildlager
products.desc: 100 proof cinnamon schnapps, made for alcoholic teen girls on spring break.

products.name: grog
products.desc: Watered-down rum, pirate approved!

products.name: Hippie's Delight
products.desc: You just don't get it maaaan.

products.name: hooch
products.desc: Either someone's failure at cocktail making or attempt in alchohol production. In any case, do you really want to drink that?

products.name: hot cocoa
products.desc: Smells like the holidays!

products.name: ice cream
products.desc: It was either this or the microwave, and nobody wants ice cream soup!

products.name: iced beer
products.desc: A beer which is so cold the air around it freezes.

products.name: iced beer
products.desc: A beer which is so cold the air around it freezes.

products.name: iced coffee
products.desc: Coffee and ice, refreshing and cool.

products.name: iced green tea
products.desc: Cold green tea.

products.name: iced tea
products.desc: No relation to a certain rap artist/actor.

products.name: Irish bool
products.desc: Like a bool in a Ireland shop.

products.name: Grenade Penguin
products.desc: What's black and white and red all over?

products.name: Irish coffee
products.desc: Coffee served with irish cream. Regular cream just isn't the same!

products.name: Irish cream
products.desc: Whiskey-imbued cream. What else could you expect from the Irish.

products.name: Jack rose
products.desc: Excessively Red.

products.name: jungle bird
products.desc: Despite the name, it’s not exceptionally popular among Voxes.

products.name: kalimotxo
products.desc: A high-class Cuba Libre, for the discerning alcoholic.

products.name: citrus bikeshed
products.desc: The soda should be orange! No, it should be lemon-lime!

products.name: lemonade
products.desc: Drink using lemon juice, water, and a sweetener such as cane sugar or honey.

products.name: Smite
products.desc: Tangy lime and lemon soda.

products.name: Long Island iced tea
products.desc: The liquor cabinet, brought together in a delicious mix. Intended for middle-aged alcoholic women only.

products.name: Manhattan
products.desc: The Detective's undercover drink of choice. He never could stomach gin...

products.name: Manhattan Project
products.desc: A scientist's drink of choice, for pondering ways to blow up the ship.

products.name: Manly Dorf
products.desc: Beer and Ale, brought together in a delicious mix. Intended for stout dwarves only.

products.name: margarita
products.desc: On the rocks with salt on the rim. Arriba~!

products.name: classic martini
products.desc: Vermouth with Gin. Not quite how 007 enjoyed it, but still delicious.

products.name: mead
products.desc: A Viking's drink, though a cheap one.

products.name: Mojito
products.desc: If it's good enough for Spesscuba, it's good enough for you.

products.name: monkey business
products.desc: You’ve got to wonder how the monkeys feel about this drink.

products.name: moonshine
products.desc: Artisanal homemade liquor. What could go wrong?

products.name: nuclear cola
products.desc: Cola, cola never changes.

products.name: ipecac
products.desc: A rapid-acting emetic. Useful for stopping unmetabolized poisons, or mass-vomiting sessions.

products.name: water
products.desc: A colorless liquid that humans need in order to survive.

products.name: sugar
products.desc: Tasty spacey sugar!

products.name: uranium
products.desc: A grey metallic chemical element in the actinide series, weakly radioactive.

products.name: Patrón
products.desc: Tequila with silver in it, a favorite of alcoholic women in the club scene.

products.name: painkiller
products.desc: A cure for what ails you.

products.name: Piña Colada
products.desc: For getting lost in the rain.

products.name: posca
products.desc: Poor warriors' drink from a forgotten era.

products.name: radler
products.desc: A simple but staple classic, straight out of Space-Germany.

products.name: red mead
products.desc: The true Viking's drink! Even though it has a strange red color.

products.name: Rewriter
products.desc: The secret of the sanctuary of the Librarian...

products.name: root beer float
products.desc: Root beer, but now with ice cream on top. It truly is the magnum opus of Canadian summertime drinks.

products.name: Roy Rogers
products.desc: Solid proof that there IS something known as too sweet.

products.name: rubberneck
products.desc: A popular drink amongst those adhering to an all synthetic diet.

products.name: sbiten
products.desc: A spicy Vodka! Might be a little hot for the little guys!

products.name: screwdriver
products.desc: Vodka, mixed with plain ol' orange juice. The result is surprisingly delicious.

products.name: Shirley Temple
products.desc: A favorite amongst younger members of the crew.

products.name: silencer
products.desc: A drink from Mime Heaven.

products.name: Snow White
products.desc: A cold refreshment.

products.name: soda water
products.desc: A container of club soda. Why not make a scotch and soda?

products.name: soy latte
products.desc: A coffee drink made with espresso and steamed soy milk.

products.name: Starkist
products.desc: A sweet, orange flavored soft drink.

products.name: sui dream
products.desc: 'Comprised of: White soda, blue Curaçao, melon liquor.'

products.name: syndicate bomb
products.desc: Somebody set us up the bomb!

products.name: tea
products.desc: A drink made by boiling leaves of the tea tree, Camellia sinensis.

products.name: tequila sunrise
products.desc: Tequila and orange juice. Much like a Screwdriver, only Mexican.

products.name: Three Mile Island iced tea
products.desc: "Made for a woman, strong enough for a man."

products.name: Tortuga
products.desc: Perfect for pirates who’ve been selected as the designated driver. Yarr!

products.name: toxins special
products.desc: This thing is ON FIRE! CALL THE DAMN SHUTTLE!

products.name: vampiro
products.desc: Popular in Mexico and Transylvania.

products.name: vodka martini
products.desc: Vodka instead of Gin. Not quite how 007 enjoyed it, but still delicious.

products.name: vodka red bool
products.desc: Because heart failure and liver failure go hand in hand.

products.name: vodka tonic
products.desc: For when a gin and tonic isn't russian enough.

products.name: whiskey cola
products.desc: Whiskey, mixed with cola. Surprisingly refreshing.

products.name: watermelon wakeup
products.desc: If you want to be awake, this will do it... Also sweet.

products.name: White Russian
products.desc: That's just, like, your opinion, man...

products.name: whiskey soda
products.desc: For the more refined griffon.

products.name: Xeno Basher
products.desc: The perfect drink before an expedition.

products.name: hot ramen
products.desc: Hot noodles.

products.name: pilk
products.desc: A sickening mixture of milk and cola.

products.name: The Martinez
products.desc: The edgerunner legend. Remembered by a drink, forgotten by a drunk.

products.name: vodka
products.desc: Clear distilled alcoholic beverage that originates from Poland and Russia.

products.name: hydrogen
products.desc: A light, flammable gas.

products.name: oxygen
products.desc: An oxidizing, colorless gas.

products.name: White Gilgamesh
products.desc: A sickening mixture of milk and beer. Makes you feel like you're made of wood.

products.name: Space Cola
products.desc: A sweet, carbonated soft drink.

products.name: caipirinha
products.desc: The São Paulo special, straight from old Brazil.

products.name: daiquiri
products.desc: A classic rum cocktail which remains popular even in the cold reaches of space.

products.name: death in the afternoon
products.desc: "Pour one jigger absinthe into a Champagne glass. Add iced Champagne until it attains the proper opalescent milkiness. Drink three to five of these slowly." - Ernest Hemingway

products.name: empress 75
products.desc: A more refined take on the mimosa. Just the thing Marie Antoinette might've sipped on before the revolution.

products.name: espresso martini
products.desc: To wake you up and wind you down. Garnished with coffee beans and icy-cold.

products.name: mayojito
products.desc: An affront to god and man. Do not drink it.

products.name: mimeosa
products.desc: It has an orange tang so sour you just can't describe it.

products.name: mimosa
products.desc: Perfect for a lively brunch out with the girls.

products.name: moscow mule
products.desc: A surpsingly strong and refreshing mixed drink, served in an iconic copper mug.

products.name: the sun also rises
products.desc: A strong cocktail mixed into a murky blend. A secret favorite of tortured authors.

products.name: whiskey sour
products.desc: What's the secret ingredient? Eggs. It's eggs.

products.name: Zombie
products.desc: It gets in your head. Your he-eyeh-ead.

products.name: bacchus's blessing
products.desc: You didn't think it was possible for a liquid to be so utterly revolting. Are you sure about this...?

products.name: ketchup
products.desc: Made from pureed tomatoes and flavored with spices.

products.name: mayonnaise
products.desc: Creamy sauce, made from oil, egg, and some (edible) acid.

products.desc: Basic yellow mustard, made from the seeds of the mustard plant.

products.desc: Hand wipes not included.

products.desc: A basic salad dressing made with oil, vinegar and seasoning.

products.desc: Tasty spacey sugar!

products.name: cream
products.desc: The fatty, still liquid part of milk. Why don't you mix this with sum scotch, eh?

products.name: carpetium
products.desc: A mystical chemical, usually outsourced from the Clown Planet, that covers everything it touches in carpet. Somehow filters out carpotoxin from the blood stream.

products.name: buzzochloric bees
products.desc: Liquid bees. Oh god it's LIQUID BEES NO-

products.name: space glue
products.desc: Space Glue is a high performance glue intended for maintenance of extremely complex mechanical equipment (and certainly not used to make people stick to the floor).

products.name: licoxide
products.desc: A synthetic battery acid. It looks... electrifying.

products.name: ice
products.desc: Frozen water.

products.name: Fresium
products.desc: A mysterious compound that slows the vibration of atoms and molecules... somehow. In layman's terms, it makes things cold... REALLY cold. Can cause long-lasting movement issues if ingested.

products.name: carbon
products.desc: A black, crystalline solid.

products.name: sugar
products.desc: Tasty spacey sugar!

products.name: laughter
products.desc: Some say that this is the best medicine, but recent studies have proven that to be untrue.

products.name: corgium
products.desc: Tastes like dog food. Clearly an acquired taste.

products.name: felinase
products.desc: A type of carcinogenic enzyme known to break down proteins found within the vocal cords of most animals. Mixing is NOT recommended.

products.name: caninase
products.desc: A type of carcinogenic enzyme known to break down proteins found within the vocal cords of most animals. Mixing is NOT recommended.

products.name: razorium
products.desc: A strange, non-newtonian chemical. It is produced when two conflicting brute medications are combined. When force is applied to it, it temporarily hardens creating millions of tiny, sharp edges. Very painful.

products.name: carbon
products.desc: A black, crystalline solid.

products.name: oxygen
products.desc: An oxidizing, colorless gas.

products.name: nitrogen
products.desc: A colorless, odorless unreactive gas. Highly stable.

products.name: oxygen
products.desc: An oxidizing, colorless gas.

products.name: dylovene
products.desc: A broad-spectrum anti-toxin, which treats toxin damage in organisms. Overdosing will cause vomiting, dizzyness and pain.

products.name: ethylredoxrazine
products.desc: Neutralises the effects of alcohol in the blood stream. Though it is commonly needed, it is rarely requested.

products.name: cryptobiolin
products.desc: Causes confusion and dizziness.

products.name: arithrazine
products.desc: A mildly unstable medication used for the most extreme case of radiation poisoning. Exerts minor stress on the body.

products.name: bicaridine
products.desc: An analgesic which is highly effective at treating brute damage. It's useful for stabilizing people who have been severely beaten, as well as treating less life-threatening injuries.

products.name: cryoxadone
products.desc: Required for the proper function of cryogenics. Heals all standard types of damage, but only works in temperatures under 213K. It can treat and rejuvenate plants when applied in small doses.

products.name: doxarubixadone
products.desc: A cryogenics chemical. Heals cellular damage caused by dangerous gasses and chemicals.

products.name: epinephrine
products.desc: An effective stabilizing chemical used to keep a critical person from dying to asphyxiation while patching up minor damage during crit. Flushes heartbreaker toxin out the blood stream at the cost of more epinephrine, but may add histamine. Helps reduce stun time. Commonly found in the form of emergency medipens.

products.name: dermaline
products.desc: An advanced chemical that is more effective at treating burn damage than kelotane.

products.name: dexalin
products.desc: Used for treating minor oxygen deprivation and bloodloss. A required reagent for dexalin plus.

products.name: dexalin plus
products.desc: Used in treatment of extreme cases of oxygen deprivation and bloodloss. Flushes heartbreaker toxin out of the blood stream.

products.name: hyronalin
products.desc: A weak treatment for radiation damage. A precursor to arithrazine and phalanximine. Can cause vomiting.

products.name: inaprovaline
products.desc: Inaprovaline is a synaptic stimulant and cardiostimulant, commonly used to treat asphyxiation damage caused during critical states and reduce bleeding. Used in many advanced medicines.

products.name: ipecac
products.desc: A rapid-acting emetic. Useful for stopping unmetabolized poisons, or mass-vomiting sessions.

products.name: tranexamic acid
products.desc: A blood-clotting medicine used to prevent profuse bleeding. Causes heavier bleeding on overdose. Commonly found in small doses within emergency medipens.

products.name: kelotane
products.desc: Treats burn damage. Overdosing greatly reduces the body's ability to retain water.

products.name: leporazine
products.desc: A chemical used to stabilize body temperature and rapidly cure cold damage. Great for unprotected EVA travel, but prevents the use of cryogenic tubes.

products.name: phalanximine
products.desc: An advanced chemical used in the treatment of cancer. Causes moderate radiation poisoning, acid burns, and vomiting on organics. Can potentially remove the death gene on plants.

products.name: ambuzol
products.desc: A highly engineered substance able to halt the progression of a zombie infection.

products.name: ambuzol plus
products.desc: Further engineered with omnizine, inoculates the living against the infection.

products.name: synaptizine
products.desc: A toxic chemical that halves the duration of stuns and knockdowns.

products.name: tricordrazine
products.desc: A wide-spectrum stimulant, originally derived from cordrazine. Treats minor damage of all basic health types as long as the user is not heavily wounded. Best used as an additive to other chemicals.

products.name: heartbreaker toxin
products.desc: A hallucinogenic compound derived from mindbreaker toxin. it blocks neurological signals to the respiratory system, causing asphyxiation. Dexalin plus and epinephrine will filter it out, however.

products.name: impedrezene
products.desc: A narcotic that impedes one's ability by slowing down the higher brain cell functions.

products.name: lexorin
products.desc: A fast-acting chemical used to asphyxiate people rapidly.

products.name: lipozine
products.desc: A chemical that accelerates metabolism, causing the user to hunger faster.

products.name: mannitol
products.desc: Efficiently restores brain damage.

products.name: mindbreaker toxin
products.desc: A potent hallucinogenic compound that is formerly known as LSD.

products.name: space mirage
products.desc: An illegal compound which induces a number of effects such as loss of balance and visual artefacts.

products.name: ultravasculine
products.desc: A complicated anti-toxin solution that quickly flushes out toxin while causing minor stress on the body. Reacts with histamine, duplicating itself while flushing it out. Overdose causes extreme pain.

products.name: oculine
products.desc: A simple saline compound used to treat the eyes via ingestion.

products.name: siderlac
products.desc: A powerful anti-caustic medicine derived from plants.

products.name: cognizine
products.desc: A mysterious chemical which is able to make any non-sentient creature sentient.

products.name: sigynate
products.desc: A thick pink syrup useful for neutralizing acids and soothing trauma caused by acids. Tastes sweet!

products.name: saline
products.desc: A mixture of salt and water. Commonly used to treat dehydration or low fluid presence in blood.

products.name: lacerinol
products.desc: A fairly unreactive chemical that boosts collagen sythesis to incredible levels, healing slash trauma.

products.name: puncturase
products.desc: A fizzy chemical that helps rebuild trauma caused by piercing damage, leaving a slight amount of tissue damage behind.

products.name: bruizine
products.desc: Originally developed as a cough medicine, it turns out this chemical is wildly effective at treating blunt force trauma.

products.name: razorium
products.desc: A strange, non-newtonian chemical. It is produced when two conflicting brute medications are combined. When force is applied to it, it temporarily hardens creating millions of tiny, sharp edges. Very painful.

products.name: razorium
products.desc: A strange, non-newtonian chemical. It is produced when two conflicting brute medications are combined. When force is applied to it, it temporarily hardens creating millions of tiny, sharp edges. Very painful.

products.name: razorium
products.desc: A strange, non-newtonian chemical. It is produced when two conflicting brute medications are combined. When force is applied to it, it temporarily hardens creating millions of tiny, sharp edges. Very painful.

products.name: razorium
products.desc: A strange, non-newtonian chemical. It is produced when two conflicting brute medications are combined. When force is applied to it, it temporarily hardens creating millions of tiny, sharp edges. Very painful.

products.name: razorium
products.desc: A strange, non-newtonian chemical. It is produced when two conflicting brute medications are combined. When force is applied to it, it temporarily hardens creating millions of tiny, sharp edges. Very painful.

products.name: razorium
products.desc: A strange, non-newtonian chemical. It is produced when two conflicting brute medications are combined. When force is applied to it, it temporarily hardens creating millions of tiny, sharp edges. Very painful.

products.name: diphenhydramine
products.desc: Rapidly purges the body of histamine, reduces jitteriness, causes drowsiness, and treats poison damage. Often included in sleep medication.

products.name: pyrazine
products.desc: Efficiently heals burns from the hottest of fires. Causes massive internal bleeding when overdosed.

products.name: insuzine
products.desc: Rapidly repairs dead tissue caused by electrocution, but cools you slightly. Completely freezes the patient when overdosed.

products.name: opporozidone
products.desc: A difficult to synthesize cryogenic drug used to regenerate rotting tissue and brain matter.

products.name: necrosol
products.desc: A necrotic substance that seems to be able to heal frozen corpses. It can treat and rejuvenate plants when applied in small doses.

products.name: aloxadone
products.desc: A cryogenics chemical. Used to treat severe burns and frostbite via regeneration of the affected tissue. Works regardless of the patient being alive or dead.

products.name: psicodine
products.desc: Suppresses anxiety and other various forms of mental distress. Overdose causes hallucinations and minor toxin damage.

products.name: lipolicide
products.desc: A powerful toxin that will destroy fat cells, massively reducing body weight in a short time. Deadly to those without nutriment in their body.

products.name: happiness
products.desc: Fills you with ecstatic numbness and causes minor brain damage. Highly addictive. If overdosed causes sudden mood swings.

products.name: potassium iodide
products.desc: Will reduce the damaging effects of radiation by 90%. Prophylactic use only.

products.name: haloperidol
products.desc: Removes most stimulating and hallucinogenic drugs. Reduces druggy effects and jitteriness. Causes drowsiness.

products.name: napalm
products.desc: It's just a little flammable.

products.name: phlogiston
products.desc: Catches you on fire and makes you ignite.

products.name: chlorine trifluoride
products.desc: You really, REALLY don't want to get this shit anywhere near you.

products.name: ash
products.desc: A light grey powdery residue

products.name: ethanol
products.desc: A simple alcohol, makes you drunk if consumed, flammable.

products.name: hydrogen
products.desc: A light, flammable gas.

products.name: sulfur
products.desc: A yellow, crystalline solid.

products.name: protein
products.desc: Found in certain meals, good for bodily health.

products.name: cooked egg
products.desc: Cooked chicken embryo, delicious.

products.name: syrup
products.desc: Delicious syrup made from tree sap, somehow stickier than glue.

products.name: wine
products.desc: A premium alcoholic beverage made from distilled grape juice.

products.name: holy water
products.desc: The cleanest and purest of waters straight from the hands of god, is known to magically heal wounds.
